intro: Galium subnemorale, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its opposite, heart-shaped leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are often hairy, and it produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds. Galium subnemorale is widely distributed across North America and is often found in forested areas.
